TopicTitle: You discover an asteroid. What do you name it?

Articles.Content:
You send pictures to the observatory computer after you use the telescopes a bit. Congrats, you discover an asteroid. It's not by any means the best thing to discover, there are freaking millions of them, but it's a good start.

You get to name it, of course. You can name it your last name (if you're Smith, then do us a favor and don't ), but that's not creative.

You can't name it something expletive, your name would get rejected.

So, what do you name it?

I'll start. I'll name mine Tony, after Tony Probe.
I'll name mine Jebediah. Simple.

I'd name it

Splat

If you discover a comet it's named after you. If you discover an asteroid you name it. I will name it Yahweh or maybe Allah. Or to put it even simpler, God. Why? Almost all celestial objects are named after gods, so what about the Jewish/Islamic/Christian god? I'd do this really just to make people rage, because I'm a bit of a troll to religious people.

Kraken.

My favorite asteroid name is "99942 Apophis" because the discoverers were Stargate SG1 fans.

I would troll all the conspiracy theorists by calling it

-WARNING- debug4535//blockedbyuserCIA//COLLISION:COURSE;DETECTED

Dottie.

(lets see who gets it )

Gilly.

Or Kasteroid just to make some people mad

Dottie.

(lets see who gets it )

She's a vicious lifesucking b**** from which there's no escape

Well, we have Uranus, so just to out-troll this name i would call my asteroid Urmomma.
